answers.1A: ** If XCl2 then X should be a metal with valency 2 Therefore - (1) Sulphate formula : XSO4 (2) Hydroxide formula : X(OH)2 - **
answers.1B: ** XN is nitride X is a valency 3 metal as nitrogen has valency 3 Therefore Sulphate's formula would be X2(SO4)3 and Hydroxide formula would be X(OH)3 - **
answers.1C: ** valency of Nitrogen in : - 1) NO : +2 - 2) N2O : +1 3) NO2 : +4 - **
answers.2B: ** The eight metals showing variable valency - 1) Iron(Fe) : +2,+3 - 2) Copper(Cu) : +1 , +2 - 3) Mercury(Hg) : +1, +2 - 4) Tin(Hn) : +2 , +4 - 5) Lead(Pb) : +2 , +4 - 6) Gold(Au) : +1,+3 - 7) Chromium(Cr) : +2,+3,+6 - 8) Manganese(Mn) : +2,+3,+4,+6,+7 - **
answers.2C: ** Examples of Chemical Equations : ## Page 2 - **(a) One product: 2H2 + O2 ﬁ 2H2O** - **(b) Two Products: CaCO3 ﬁ Cao + CO2 + Scribble** (Unknown symbol) - **(c) Three Products: 4HN03 ﬁ 2H2O + 4NO2 + O2** - **(d) Four Products: 2KCIO3 ﬁ 2KCI + 2O2 + O2 + Scribble** (Unknown symbol) - **
